title: Applied & Collaborative Learning Environment - STLA - SIT

meta.description: A SIT Teaching and Learning Academy (STLA) initiative to catalyse student-centred learning in SIT. ACE rooms are equipped with computers-on-wheels and flexible seating.

text_lines: A learning space suitable for student-centred learning pedagogies through its flexible seating arrangement and collaboration-on-wheels.
Imagine your students working in groups, writing on touch screens, capturing and sharing their ideas instantly through the computers in the class.
Welcome to ACE, an initiative to advance student-centred learning pedagogies in SIT.

Through activities such as project work, students are required to apply their knowledge to specific situations and collaborate with peers to solve complex, higher-order thinking problems. As the instructor, you act as a facilitator of learning by providing guidance and challenging the students’ thinking where appropriate.
Available across the SIT campus, these rooms are designed and equipped to promote group discussions and team-based learning.
Modular furniture such as chairs on casters
Tables and cabinets with writable surfaces (selected rooms only)
Collaboration-on-wheels (COWs): movable digital workspaces with large touchscreen monitors that students use for brainstorming, research, and presentations
Computer management software in the instructor’s COW for you to present content, and send files or an individual group’s screen to all COWs in the room
To book an ACE room for activities held
of each trimester, you can submit the
, please use the self-service booking in
. Priority will be given to those who require the COWs for applied and collaborative learning in their classes.
User guides are available in SharePoint
(login required) for the tools found in ACE rooms, such as COW, NetSupport School software, Samsung Flip and Catchbox.
For technical assistance with the AV system or COWs, approach the IT Help Desk on the various campuses.

Talk to the STLA educational developer team about ACE-related lesson planning, training and classroom support. We can conduct a familiarisation session for you at your request and at least one day before your first class in an ACE room.
Learn More With SIT Teaching and Learning Academy
Find out what learning design means and how STLA can help academic staff incorporate it into their teaching.
Online learning mixed with face-to-face instruction to increase interaction and flexibility.

article_texts:
Applied & Collaborative Learning Environment (ACE)
A learning space suitable for student-centred learning pedagogies through its flexible seating arrangement and collaboration-on-wheels.
The concept behind ACE
Imagine your students working in groups, writing on touch screens, capturing and sharing their ideas instantly through the computers in the class.
Welcome to ACE, an initiative to advance student-centred learning pedagogies in SIT.
Through activities such as project work, students are required to apply their knowledge to specific situations and collaborate with peers to solve complex, higher-order thinking problems. As the instructor, you act as a facilitator of learning by providing guidance and challenging the students’ thinking where appropriate.
ACE rooms at SIT
Available across the SIT campus, these rooms are designed and equipped to promote group discussions and team-based learning.
Room features:
Modular furniture such as chairs on casters
Whiteboards
Tables and cabinets with writable surfaces (selected rooms only)
Collaboration-on-wheels (COWs): movable digital workspaces with large touchscreen monitors that students use for brainstorming, research, and presentations
Computer management software in the instructor’s COW for you to present content, and send files or an individual group’s screen to all COWs in the room
How to book ACE rooms
To book an ACE room for activities held
between week 1 to 5
of each trimester, you can submit the
venue booking form
to APA. For activities held
from week 5 onwards
, please use the self-service booking in
Resource Booking System (RBS)
. Priority will be given to those who require the COWs for applied and collaborative learning in their classes.

Tech help & guidance
User guides are available in SharePoint
(login required) for the tools found in ACE rooms, such as COW, NetSupport School software, Samsung Flip and Catchbox.
For technical assistance with the AV system or COWs, approach the IT Help Desk on the various campuses.

Talk to the STLA educational developer team about ACE-related lesson planning, training and classroom support. We can conduct a familiarisation session for you at your request and at least one day before your first class in an ACE room.
